alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:17AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of heavy showers will impact portions of southwestern Nicholas and Fayette Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 714 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of heavy showers over Gauley Bridge, or 8 miles northwest of Fayetteville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Fayetteville, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Montgomery, Ansted, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Powellton, Hawks Nest State Park, Thurmond, Canvas, Swiss, Calvin, Kesslers Cross Lanes, Drennan and Mount Nebo. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 58 and 67. Route 19 between mile markers 8 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.
